pages.description: Learn about the National Conservation Commission (NCC) in Barbados, which issues licenses for selling goods and services in public parks, gardens, and beaches, and provides contact information for its various departments.

pages.description: This page indicates that the requested content was not found on the Government of Barbados website (GOV.BB).

pages.title: National Cultural Foundation
pages.description: Details the National Cultural Foundation's dual role in fostering national development through culture and promoting cultural festivals.

pages.title: National Housing Corporation
pages.description: The National Housing Corporation is committed to finding acceptable housing solutions for Barbadians at affordable prices, focusing on efficient land use and diverse housing units.

pages.title: Barbados National Oil Company
pages.description: The Barbados National Oil Company Limited (BNOCL) was incorporated in February 1983 and focuses on the economic exploration and production of Barbados' hydrocarbon potential, while also ensuring a sustainable, efficient, and reliable supply of energy products to the country.

pages.title: National Petroleum Corporation
pages.description: The National Petroleum Corporation (NPC) is a statutory body responsible for natural gas distribution in Barbados, working with Barbados National Oil Company (BNOCL) for oil, gas, and LPG production.

pages.title: Barbados National Standards Institution
pages.description: The Barbados National Standards Institution (BNSI) is a joint undertaking between the Government of Barbados and the private sector, established in 1973 as a non-profit benevolent organization.

pages.title: Barbados National Terminal Co. Ltd.
pages.description: Contact information for the Barbados National Terminal Co. Ltd., including their address and phone numbers.

pages.title: Natural Resources Unit
pages.description: Contact information for the Natural Resources Unit, located at Trinity Business Centre Inc. in St. Michael, Barbados.

pages.title: Commission for Pan-African Affairs
pages.description: An overview of the Government of Barbados's Commission for Pan-African Affairs.

pages.title: Personnel Administration
pages.description: An overview of personnel administration policies and procedures within the Government of Barbados.

pages.title: Poverty Alleviation Bureau
pages.description: Contact information for the Poverty Alleviation Bureau in Barbados, including its address, phone numbers, and website link.

pages.title: Process Serving
pages.description: An overview of process serving in Barbados, detailing how legal documents are delivered.

pages.title: The Productivity Council
pages.description: The Productivity Council (formerly the National Productivity Board) was established in 1993 by an Act of Parliament to further the objectives of the Protocol for the Implementation of a Prices and Incomes Policy.

pages.title: Office of Public Counsel
pages.description: Contact information for the Office of Public Counsel, including addresses, phone numbers, and a link to their official website.

pages.title: Public Investment Unit
pages.description: Contact information for the Public Investment Unit under the Ministry of Finance and Economic Affairs in Barbados.

pages.title: Efficiency Unit (formerly Office of Public Sector Reform)
pages.description: The Efficiency Unit facilitates transformational change across the public service by helping Ministries, Departments, and Agencies improve performance and align with government strategic priorities.

pages.title: Queen Elizabeth Hospital
pages.description: The Queen Elizabeth Hospital (QEH) is Barbados' primary acute care medical facility and an accredited teaching hospital.

pages.title: Barbados Revenue Authority
pages.description: An introduction to the Barbados Revenue Authority (BRA) and its commitment to taxpayer services, including contact information for the Revenue Commissioner and a link to their website.

pages.title: Rural Development Commission
pages.description: Provides contact information for the Government of Barbados' Rural Development Commission, including its address, phone numbers, and email.

pages.title: Oops! You're lost.
pages.description: An error page indicating that the requested content could not be found on GOV.BB, suggesting a return to the homepage or using the search bar.

pages.title: Sanitation Service Authority
pages.description: Sanitation Service Authority oversees excreta, wastewater, solid waste, and storm water management systems in Barbados.

pages.title: Scotland District Development
pages.description: This page on the Government of Barbados website currently provides no detailed information regarding Scotland District Development.

pages.title: Small Business Development Unit
pages.description: An overview of Barbados' Small Business Development Unit, outlining its purpose, the 1999-23 Act, categories of businesses, incentives, and contact information.

pages.title: Bureau of Social Policy, Research and Planning
pages.description: Contact information for the Bureau of Social Policy, Research and Planning in Barbados, including address, phone, and fax numbers.

pages.title: Soil Conservation
pages.description: Contact information and a website link for the Soil Conservation Unit in Barbados.

pages.title: Southern Meats Inc.
pages.description: Contact information for Southern Meats Inc., including their address, telephone, and fax numbers.

pages.title: Special Projects - Financial
pages.description: This page provides an overview of Special Projects related to financial matters, but currently contains no detailed information.

pages.title: Sir Garfield Sobers Sports Complex Gymnasium Ltd.
pages.description: The Sir Garfield Sobers Sports Complex in Wildey, St. Michael, opened in November 1992 as a sporting facility and was part of a strategic initiative by the Government of Barbados to promote sports tourism.

pages.title: Office of Supervisor of Insolvency
pages.description: Provides contact information and location for the Office of the Supervisor of Insolvency in Barbados.

pages.title: Supreme Court
pages.description: An overview of the Barbadian judicial system, detailing the four-level court structure including the Caribbean Court of Justice, Court of Appeal, High Court, and Magistrate's Courts, along with contact information.

pages.title: Technical & Vocational Education and Training Council
pages.description: The TVET Council is a statutory organization in Barbados that plans, coordinates, and sets standards for technical and vocational education to develop a competitive workforce.

pages.title: Oops! You're lost.
pages.description: This page cannot be found. Return home or use the search bar.

pages.title: Barbados Tourism Investment Incorporated
pages.description: An overview of Barbados Tourism Investment Incorporated, outlining the growth of the tourism industry and providing contact information.

pages.title: Town and Country Planning Department
pages.description: The Town and Country Planning Department provides efficient and timely planning services to ensure the best physical environment for Barbados.

pages.title: Transport Board
pages.description: The Transport Board of Barbados was formed in August 1955 by an Act of Parliament, following draft legislation approved in June 1955, and provides public transport services.

pages.title: Urban Development Commission
pages.description: The Urban Development Commission is a social development agency that provides high-quality services to improve the living standards and quality of life for vulnerable, poor, and disadvantaged communities in Urban Barbados.

pages.title: University of the West Indies
pages.description: An overview of the University of the West Indies, Cave Hill Campus, detailing its academic offerings, accreditation, and contact information.

pages.title: Veterinary Services
pages.description: Provides contact information for the Government of Barbados Veterinary Services department.

pages.title: Barbados Vocational Training Board
pages.description: The Barbados Vocational Training Board is a premier agency of social development that designs and delivers industry-focused training to empower participants and fulfill the Government's Human Resource Development Policy.

pages.title: Barbados Water Authority
pages.description: The Barbados Water Authority (BWA) is a Statutory Body established in 1980 to replace the Waterworks Department of Government.

pages.title: Youth Entrepreneurship Scheme
pages.description: Contact information for the Youth Entrepreneurship Scheme in Barbados, including staff, address, and telephone numbers.
